column2: Has a retractable or removable roof. A convertible allows an open-air driving experience, with the ability to provide a roof when required.
Has a sloping rear roofline and generally two doors.
Car with a hatch-type rear door that is hinged at the roof and opens upwards.
Vehicle designed to transport passengers in the rear seating row(s) with reconfigurable seats in two or three rows.
An open two-seat car with emphasis on sporting appearance or character.
A 4-door passenger car with a trunk that is separate from the passengers with a three-box body: the engine, the area for passengers, and the trunk.
Combines elements of road-going passenger cars with features from off-road vehicles, such as raised ground clearance and four-wheel drive.
Has a two-box design, a large cargo area, and a rear tailgate that is hinged to open for access to the cargo area.
